title: Part 1
content:
Part 1

AFTER PROCEEDING THROUGH the forest for about five minutes, the two of us arrived at our destination.

"—Halt."

The Class D students must have been watching the two signals on their GPS heading toward them.

Ten male students, led by Kanzaki, formed a wall to protect their classmates behind them, mercilessly pointing their guns at us.

"Looks like we're gettin' a warm welcome."

Faced with a reception that made it impossible to hide, let alone escape, it seemed Hashimoto could only laugh.

"We have no intention of attacking."

Hashimoto and I raised our hands, showing that we held nothing.

"I wonder about that. There's a possibility your allies are hiding nearby."

"Nah, that ain't it. You guys are always watchin' the GPS, right?"

"If your commander is using tactics, that's not necessarily the case, as you should be well aware."

"Nah, you can only fake out the whole GPS or an individual's GPS, one or the other, y'know? There's no way to freeze the GPS of only the people other than us."

"However, it is possible to target up to three people individually."

The possibility that we had three allies use the individual GPS jamming tactic to outsmart them and lie in wait behind us, or somewhere nearby, couldn't be denied.

What Class D was wary of were three invisible, armed enemies.

While it might not have been enough to overturn a situation where they were at an overwhelming disadvantage, it could be called the only way to inflict major damage.

"Just three people ain't gonna do nothin'."

"If you were to jam the entire GPS right this instant, it would no longer be limited to three people. Am I wrong?"

"...Fair point."

Kanzaki declared to Hashimoto that there were any number of ways to deceive Class D.

"But in reality, we have no desire to fight Class D. First, let us talk."

"There's no need for that."

Saying that, Kanzaki approached us, his gun still raised.

"It seems you were caught in a surprise attack by Ryuuen and lost the morning battle as well."

"So you got a good look at our pathetic state, huh."

"If we defeat the two of you here, we can significantly lower our chances of coming in last. This is a golden opportunity."

"That might be true if you're only looking at this special exam. However, even if you defeat us, there's no guarantee you can beat Class A and Class B. Your goal isn't to avoid last place, but to aim for the top. Surely you understand that much without Ichinose having to tell you?"

Although they'd been wounded by Koenji, it remained doubtful just how much of an advantage Class D could gain against Class B, who already had combat experience, with numbers alone.

"Let's join forces. That way, Class C and Class D can form a group of fifty."

"An alliance... What if we trust you and are betrayed? That would be a crisis for our class."

Although he wore a stern expression, I didn't get a strong sense of hostility from Kanzaki.

"That's why I refuse—or rather, it's not that I don't feel like saying that and sending you away... but I can trust you, right?"

The atmosphere changed. It was a reaction as if he already understood everything about why we came.

Ichinose, their commander, had likely already given them some sort of message.

"Right now, we need Class D's help. And we believe we can be the strength that Class D needs."

As soon as I answered, Kanzaki lowered the gun he'd been holding.

As if on cue, the boys standing behind him all lowered their guns at once.

"You can bring your allies. As you wish, let's talk first."

"I'm grateful we didn't get shot, but... you're being awfully reasonable, aren't ya?"

Hashimoto, whose imagination hadn't yet reached the behind-the-scenes interactions between Ichinose and Class D, suspected this might be a trap to lure us in.

"Ichinose told us that Class C might make contact at some point. She also warned us not to make the first move until we were attacked."

"Well, what do you know— You're sayin' Ichinose saw it comin' that we'd ask for your help?"

"I also heard about the alliance. Considering that, a request for cooperation is hardly a stretch."

He shifted his gaze from Hashimoto to me, so I gave a slight nod.

Chapter 1: Opening. Survival Game Special Exam.
Chapter 7: The Time of the Decisive Battle
Epilogue: Show Me What You’ve Got
